title: Synthetic Recap
body:
BOSTON – History walked into the Boston Garden wearing Orlando Magic pinstripes.

In a stunning 107-96 road victory over the Boston Celtics, Anfernee "Penny" Hardaway authored a performance for the ages, single-handedly dismantling the Celtics with a superhuman 42-point, 8-assist, 6-rebound masterpiece. From the opening tip, it was clear this was not merely a game, but a coronation.

Hardaway was simply unguardable. He sliced through the Celtics’ defense with a dizzying array of floaters, pull-ups, and explosive drives to the rim. When Boston defenders sagged off, he buried them with a clinical 4-for-8 display from beyond the three-point arc. There was no answer, no scheme, that could contain his offensive onslaught. The Garden crowd, accustomed to historic performances from their own legends, could only watch in a mixture of frustration and awe as Hardaway piled up the points.

While Horace Grant provided crucial support with a gritty 18-point, 15-rebound double-double, this night belonged solely to Penny. His 42 points were not just a season-high; they were a statement, a career-defining explosion that reminded the entire league of his transcendent talent.

The Celtics, led by Antoine Walker’s 22 points, fought to stay within striking distance but were ultimately powerless against the whirlwind in #1. Every time they threatened a run, Hardaway had an answer—a silky jumper, a perfectly timed dish, a dagger three.

In the end, the stat sheet told the entire story: one man, one legendary night. Anfernee Hardaway didn’t just beat the Boston Celtics; he transcended the game itself, leaving an indelible mark on one of basketball’s most hallowed floors.
